e4: Maintaining the current policy, even if understood by sophisticated investors, is ethically problematic.  While switching to a transparent, unbiased reporting might cause short-term market volatility, it fosters greater trust and long-term investor confidence. This outweighs the potential for short-term negative reactions.  The reputational benefits of ethical reporting are crucial.
e5: An ethical reporting policy prioritizes transparency, accuracy, and fairness.  It avoids intentional manipulation or misleading presentations of financial data.  It also considers the potential impact on all investor classes, striving for equitable access to information.  Consistency and adherence to accounting standards are also crucial aspects of ethical financial reporting.  Furthermore,  a policy should be clearly communicated, readily accessible, and auditable.
e6: I would ask about the specific strategies the investor relations team plans to use to communicate the policy change to investors.  I'd also inquire about a detailed risk assessment of the potential short-term market reaction and mitigation plans to address any negative impacts.  Finally, I would want to know what steps will be taken to ensure all investors understand the new policy and the implications of the unbiased reporting.
